journals.notes: Basically IPv6 support is already in. I'll close this duplicate ticket - see #49.

subject: IPv6 support and widely understood "standarization"
description:
As IPv4 depletion advances, after APNIC and recently European RIPE run dry it becomes a concern to provide abilities of replacing it IP version 6 protocol.
We need full client, server and master servers support for both single and dual-stack configurations, servers using two (or more?) addresses simultaneously supplying interoperability of v4 and v6 clients, without breaking 2.60b compatibility - where possible. Adequatly activation of curl IPv6 support for game data retrieving.
It is desirable to comply with current as well as emerging computing trends and networking standards whenever possible.

Herewith I hope my humble recourse will meet with positive response, and - of course - with smirk on readers face }:->

salute morsik
